Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Interesting lack of results for ECT, I predicted there would be a fracture involving one of the two ice layers. I marked the lower (175cm-171cm) ice layer as my greatest concern, this was because the higher (197cm-195cm) ice layer doesn't have any weight on it yet, I believe if this layer got more loading it could become a problem with cold likely faceting precipitation particles underneath (195cm-182cm)

Monthly snow study pit at WYDOT weather station located on WY 22 / Teton Pass. Over a 16 day period this site has seen 18"of settlement. Rounding faceted grains were still easily identified at 59cm below a decomposing melt-freeze crust. Similar grains were also found in the base of the snow pack.

Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Massiva whumpfljud vid skidåkning vid trädgränsen, inget i skogen. Testresultaten förvånansvärt stabila. Möjligen hade svaga lagret redan kollapsat innan grävning, men whumpfandet var tydligast där skararna i snötäcket var svagare än i profilen. Sannolikt oftast på bottenfacetterna.

WX > FX. FX called for winds SW35-55 G120 dec to 75 in pm (above 8k ft), HOWEVER actual WX was considerably more calm. Due to past SW winds though, ski conditions on Waterhouse 2 were better than expected. Fresh pow! Last 200ft before Grass Lake area mostly dust-on-crust and heavily wooded. All-in-all great day. Would ski again.

Pit_Observation.activities: Pit is adjacent to avalanche: crown;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Profiili tehty Palkaskurun lumivyöryn (28.2) murtumalinjaan. Maa varvikkoa. Trigger: Va, Type: S, Fracture plane: FC, Size: 2. Vyöry oli noin 100m leveä, 70m pitkä ja kruunun korkeus 50-100cm.
